meanings.definition: The act of giving human characteristics to something that is not human.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the talking animals were examples of prosopopoeias.
meanings.sent2: The prosopopoeias in the fairy tale made the trees seem alive.
meanings.sent3: The prosopopoeias of the grumpy old chair always made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her prosopopoeias of the storm turned it into a raging monster.
meanings.sent5: The prosopopoeias of the wind whispered secrets in the night.

meanings.definition: A figure of speech in which an inanimate object or abstract idea is given human qualities.
meanings.sent1: The poet's use of prosopopoeias made the sun seem to smile down on the earth.
meanings.sent2: In literature, prosopopoeias can make a mountain seem to speak.
meanings.sent3: The prosopopoeias of the lonely moon looking down on the city was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her prosopopoeias of the clock made it seem like it was racing against time.
meanings.sent5: The prosopopoeias of the river dancing over the rocks was a beautiful image.

meanings.definition: The personification of an object or idea.
meanings.sent1: The prosopopoeias of the storm as a fierce warrior was quite vivid.
meanings.sent2: In the play, the prosopopoeias of the moon as a guiding light added depth.
meanings.sent3: The prosopopoeias of the grumpy cloud refusing to rain was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her prosopopoeias of the mountain as a sleeping giant was striking.
meanings.sent5: The prosopopoeias of the ocean as a mighty beast was unforgettable.
